main event: On June 1, 1960, a civilian observer reported seeing a luminous object near Joliet, Illinois, which lasted about 20 minutes.
interesting points: The object had a round shape with an irregular upper portion, emitted a brilliant white light similar to molten metal, and at times, a yellowish-white beam was visible., The object was visible to multiple witnesses, with reports confirming about 75 individuals observing it., The object appeared to have a swinging motion resembling a pendulum for short periods., The sight was categorized as a probable satellite or possibly a balloon based on official conclusions., Weather conditions during the sighting were clear with good visibility, contributing to the observation.
sighted object: Luminous object with a round shape and an irregular upper portion, emitting white and yellowish-white light.
witness description: Civilian observers including individuals such as an accountant and amateur astronomers, with good reliability in their accounts.
